SEARCH
Package musicSerialization

Klasse Song

java.lang.Object
musicSerialization.Song
Alle implementierten Schnittstellen:
Serializable
public class Song extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a single song with metadata including artist and album associations, track details, and file information.

This class implements Serializable and supports conversion to and from a semicolon-delimited string representation.

  • Konstruktordetails

    • Song

      public Song(int artistID, int albumID, String title, int trackNumber, String format, double length, String bitrate, String filename)
      Constructs a new Song instance with the specified properties.
      Parameter:
      artistID - the unique identifier of the artist
      albumID - the unique identifier of the album
      title - the title of the song
      trackNumber - the track number within the album
      format - the audio format (e.g., "MP3", "FLAC")
      length - the duration of the song in seconds
      bitrate - the audio bitrate (e.g., "320kbps")
      filename - the filename or path where the song file is stored

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a semicolon-delimited string representation of this song.

      Format: artistID;albumID;title;trackNumber;format;length;bitrate;filename

      Setzt außer Kraft:
      toString in Klasse Object
      Gibt zurück:
      the serialized song string

    • fromString

      public static Song fromString(String data)
      Creates a Song instance by parsing a semicolon-delimited string.

      Expected format: artistID;albumID;title;trackNumber;format;length;bitrate;filename

      Parameter:
      data - the semicolon-delimited song data string
      Gibt zurück:
      a new Song object populated with parsed values
      Löst aus:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the input string is null, has an incorrect number of fields, or if numeric parsing fails
